column4: i get an i/o error when trying to copy a 40gb file from trash... is there a tool out there for this?
copy from trash does not make a lot of sense really.  The fact that you are receiving an i/o error is in no way connected with the items being copied residing "in the trash".
what if you instead move the files?
i get an i/o error in nautilus and cli
no matter where i try to copy to
it kind of sounds like the media the files reside on is damaged.
you can use something like ddrescue to copy all of the readable areas of the file and replace the damaged pieces with zeros.
I would recommend using "badblocks" for that job.
yes, you can preform a read-only test on your hard drive while partitions on it are mounted.
would it be better to check from livedisk?
I don't see any reason why that would be better.  You could though.
so it could do read/write test..
Well, there is that.  Be aware that the write/read test is destructive.  It will erase anything on the device beng tested.
